cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles west of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast and then expected to turn northwest over southern Louisiana into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near or just south of Metropolitan New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Louisiana coastline, Mississippi and Alabama Gulf coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (3–5 ft possible in Lake Borgne/Lake Pontchartrain area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along south-facing shores, Lake Borgne and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated totals near 5 inches; risk of flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous surf and rip currents, possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands
